intro: Chamaesyce forbesii, commonly known as the Forbess' sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Chamaesyce forbesii is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun.
